comment._content: this is almost certainly around Sept 1-6 1914. when all the vehicles in Paris were taken under martial law to move troops to the front to prepare for the Battle of the Marne, stopping the Germans and starting the trench warfare that lasted for 4 more years.  On the afternoon of the 6th, 600 taxis were lined up and inspected by General Gallieni, who exclaimed in French, "Well, here at least is something out of the ordinary!"
